reg_info.full_title: O. Reg. 414/03: TRANSITION MATTERS - CITY OF LONDON
reg_info.citation: O. Reg. 414/03: TRANSITION MATTERS - CITY OF LONDON
reg_info.act_under: Municipal Act, 2001   Loi de 2001 sur les municipalités

content.content: 1. Despite the repeal of the London-Middlesex Act, 1992 and the revocation of Ontario Regulation 931/93, that regulation, as it read on December 31, 2002 shall be deemed to be a by-law of the City of London and the deemed by-law, (a) includes any amendments to the regulation made by the City of London under subsection 45 (5) of the London-Middlesex Act, 1992 before its repeal; and (b) may not, unless the approval of the Ontario Municipal Board is first obtained, be further amended or repealed by the City of London. O. Reg. 414/03, s. 1.
content.raw_html:
1. Despite the repeal of the London-Middlesex Act, 1992 and the revocation of Ontario Regulation 931/93, that regulation, as it read on December 31, 2002 shall be deemed to be a by-law of the City of London and the deemed by-law,

(a) includes any amendments to the regulation made by the City of London under subsection 45 (5) of the London-Middlesex Act, 1992 before its repeal; and

(b) may not, unless the approval of the Ontario Municipal Board is first obtained, be further amended or repealed by the City of London. O. Reg. 414/03, s. 1.

content.section: City of London — property tax phase-in
content.content: 2. Despite the revocation of Ontario Regulation 291/94, that regulation continues to apply to the City of London until January 1, 2004. O. Reg. 414/03, s. 2.
content.raw_html: 2. Despite the revocation of Ontario Regulation 291/94, that regulation continues to apply to the City of London until January 1, 2004. O. Reg. 414/03, s. 2.
